DOC.brief_summary: The present study aims to investigate the relative efficacy, safety and risk of a single-dose prophylaxis in otherwise healthy adult patients undergoing ureteroscopic procedures for ureteral stones.
DOC.brief_title: Is Prophylactic Antibiotics Necessary In Otherwise Healthy Adult Patients Undergoing Ureteroscopic Procedures for Ureteral Stones?
DOC.criteria: 100 otherwise healthy adult patients. Aged from 20 to 65 years. Undergoing ureteroscopic procedures for ureteral stones. Have the urine road the infection before the surgical operation, the surgical operation once took antibiotics the first 2 week. Pregnant or the women been breast feeding.
